sen.j: 長弓寺（ちょうきゅうじ）は、奈良県生駒市上町にある真言律宗の寺院。
sen.e: Chokyu-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect, located in Kamimachi, Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
Chokyu-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect, located in Kamimachi, Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.
Chokyu-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect, located in Kamimachi, Ikoma City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は真弓山。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Mayumisan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Mayumisan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Mayumisan.

sen.j: 本尊は十一面観音。
sen.e: The principal image is eleven-faced Kannon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The principal image is eleven-faced Kannon.
The principal image is eleven-faced Kannon.

sen.j: 開基（創立者）は行基と伝える。
sen.e: It is said the kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)was Gyoki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said the kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)was Gyoki.
It is said the kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding)was Gyoki.

sen.j: 国宝の本堂は鎌倉時代の密教仏堂の代表作として知られる。
sen.e: The main hall, a national treasure, is known as one of the representative Esoteric Buddhist halls in the Kamakura period.
The main hall, a national treasure, is known as a representative of Esoteric Buddhist halls built in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 意味がはっきりするよう表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: The main hall, a national treasure, is known as a representative of Esoteric Buddhist halls built in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 長弓寺の創建についてはいくつかの説があり、定説を見ない。
sen.e: There are several opinions on the foundation of Chokyu-ji Temple, and there is no indisputable one.
There are several opinions on the foundation of Chokyu-ji Temple, and there is no indisputable one.
There are several opinions on the foundation of Chokyu-ji Temple, and there is no indisputable one.

sen.j: 『長弓寺縁起』によると奈良時代に息子の流れ矢に当たって死んだ豪族・真弓長弓（まゆみたけゆみ）を悼み、聖武天皇が僧・行基に開かせたと伝わる。
sen.e: According to "Chokyu-ji engi," paying a tribute to a local ruler, Mayumi Takeyumi, who had died by a stray arrow shot by his son in the Nara period, Emperor Shomu ordered a priest, Gyoki, to found the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Chokyu-ji engi," in the Nara period, Emperor Shomu ordered Priest Gyoki to found the temple to pay a tribute to a local ruler, Mayumi Takeyumi, who had died by a stray arrow shot by his son.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするため若干修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Chokyu-ji engi," in the Nara period, Emperor Shomu ordered Priest Gyoki to found the temple to pay a tribute to a local ruler, Mayumi Takeyumi, who had died by a stray arrow shot by his son.

sen.j: 後に藤原良継が堂塔を整えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu completed the temple buildings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu completed the temple buildings.
It is said that later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu completed the temple buildings.

sen.j: 盛時には塔頭が20院あったとされるが、現在は4坊が残るのみである。
sen.e: It is said the temple had 20 sub-temples at its best time, but only four remain today.
It is said the temple had 20 sub-temples at its best time, but only four remain today.
It is said the temple had 20 sub-temples at its best time, but only four remain today.

sen.j: 伝承によれば、神亀5年（728年）、鳥見郷の小野真弓長弓（おののまゆみたけゆみ）という人物が聖武天皇に随行して狩りに出た。
sen.e: A legend says a person called ONO no Mayumi Takeyumi from 鳥見郷 accompanied Emperor Shomu for hunting in 728.
sen.cmt: 読み不明。下の（登美）からTomi-goと思われますが。
sen.e: A legend says a person called ONO no Mayumi Takeyumi from 鳥見郷 accompanied Emperor Shomu for hunting in 728.
A legend says a person called ONO no Mayumi Takeyumi from 鳥見郷 accompanied Emperor Shomu for hunting in 728.

sen.j: 同行していた長弓の息子・長麻呂が不思議な鳥が飛び立つのを見て矢を放ったところ、矢は誤って長弓に当たり、彼は死んでしまった。
sen.e: When Nagamaro, Takeyumi's son, who was with him, saw a strange bird taking off, and shot an arrow, the arrow hit Takeyumi by mistake, and he died.
When Nagamaro, Takeyumi's son and one of the attendants, saw a strange bird take off and shot an arrow, the arrow hit Takeyumi by mistake and he died.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくするため若干修正しました。
sen.e: When Nagamaro, Takeyumi's son and one of the attendants, saw a strange bird take off and shot an arrow, the arrow hit Takeyumi by mistake and he died.

sen.j: 不運な長弓父子を哀れんだ聖武は僧・行基に命じて一寺を建立させた。
sen.e: Pitying unfortunate Takeyumi and his son, Shomu ordered a priest, Gyoki, to construct a temple.
Pitying unfortunate Takeyumi and his son, Shomu ordered Priest Gyoki to construct a temple.
Pitying unfortunate Takeyumi and his son, Shomu ordered Priest Gyoki to construct a temple.

sen.j: 行基は十一面観音像を安置してこれを本尊とした。
sen.e: Gyoki placed an image of eleven-faced Kannon as the principal image of Buddha.
Gyoki placed an image of eleven-faced Kannon as the principal image of Buddha.
Gyoki placed an image of eleven-faced Kannon as the principal image of Buddha.

sen.j: 十一面観音像の頭頂には仏面が乗っているが、これは聖武の弓を刻んだものだという。
sen.e: The image of eleven-faced Kannon has an additional head of Buddha on its head, which is said to have been carved out of an arrow of Shomu's.
The image of eleven-faced Kannon has an additional head of Buddha on its head, which is said to have been carved out of Emperor Shomu's arrow.
sen.cmt: 文法（所有格の部分）を直しました。
sen.e: The image of eleven-faced Kannon has an additional head of Buddha on its head, which is said to have been carved out of Emperor Shomu's arrow.

sen.j: なお「鳥見（登美）」は、長弓寺の位置する生駒山東麓を指す古い地名で、神武天皇東征神話にも登場する。
sen.e: And, "鳥見 (登美)" which is the old place name indicating the eastern mountain foot of Mt. Ikoma where Chokyu-ji is located appeared in the myth of Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of Emperor Jinmu).
sen.cmt: "鳥見 (登美）"は読み不明。神武天皇東征は、用語集の神武東征と同一とみなしました。
sen.e: Incidentally, the word "Tomi (鳥見 or 登美)," which is the old place name indicating the eastern mountain foot of Mt. Ikoma where Chokyu-ji Temple is located, appears in the myth of Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of Emperor Jinmu).
sen.cmt: 主部が長いので、分かりやすくしました。鳥見 (登美）の読みは、複数のウェブサイトより「とみ」で良いと思います。
sen.e: Incidentally, the word "Tomi (鳥見 or 登美)," which is the old place name indicating the eastern mountain foot of Mt. Ikoma where Chokyu-ji Temple is located, appears in the myth of Jinmu tosei (Eastern expedition of Emperor Jinmu).

sen.j: 現在の奈良市西部から生駒市にあたる。
sen.e: It is presently the area from the west part of Nara City to Ikoma City.
It is presently the area from the west part of Nara City to Ikoma City.
It is presently the area from the west part of Nara City to Ikoma City.

sen.j: その後、桓武天皇（737年－806年）の時代に藤原良継（716年－777年）が再興したというが、桓武の即位は良継没後の781年であるので時代的に合わない。
sen.e: It is said later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (716 to 777) restored it in the rein of Kanmu Emperor (737 to 806), but it does not match the history, because Kanmu's accession to the throne was in 781 after the death of Yoshitsugu.

It is said later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (716 to 777) restored it in the reign of Kanmu Emperor (737 to 806), but it does not match the history because Kanmu's accession to the throne was in 781 after the death of Yoshitsugu.

It is said later, FUJIWARA no Yoshitsugu (716 to 777) restored it in the reign of Kanmu Emperor (737 to 806), but it does not match the history because Kanmu's accession to the throne was in 781 after the death of Yoshitsugu.

sen.j: 別の伝承では平安時代初期に藤原緒継（774年－843年）によって創建されたともいう。
sen.e: Another legend says the temple was founded by FUJIWARA no Otsugu (774 to 843) in the early Heian period.
Another legend says the temple was founded by FUJIWARA no Otsugu (774 to 843) in the early Heian period.
Another legend says the temple was founded by FUJIWARA no Otsugu (774 to 843) in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 以後、中世までの沿革はあまりはっきりしていないが、現在の本堂は棟木銘から弘安2年（1279年）の建立であることが明らかである。
sen.e: Although the history of the temple since then until the Medieval period is not so clear, it is obvious that the existing main hall was founded in 1279, according to the signature on a ridgepole.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the history of the temple since then until the Medieval period is not so clear, it is obvious that the existing main hall was founded in 1279, according to the signature on a ridgepole.
Although the history of the temple since then until the Medieval period is not so clear, it is obvious that the existing main hall was founded in 1279, according to the signature on a ridgepole.

sen.j: 真言律宗の祖・叡尊（1201 - 1290）によって再興されたものである。
sen.e: It was restored by Eison (1201 to 1290), who was the founder of the Shingon Ritsu sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was restored by Eison (1201 to 1290), who was the founder of the Shingon Ritsu sect.
It was restored by Eison (1201 to 1290), who was the founder of the Shingon Ritsu sect.

sen.j: 長弓寺の境内東側にある伊弉諾（いざなぎ）神社は、明治の神仏分離以前は牛頭天王社（ごずてんのうしゃ）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shrine, located in the east side of Chokyu-ji precincts, was called Gozutenno-sha before the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism in Meiji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shrine, located in the east side of Chokyu-ji precincts, was called Gozutenno-sha before the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism in Meiji.
Izanagi-jinja Shrine, located in the east side of Chokyu-ji precincts, was called Gozutenno-sha before the separation of Buddhism and Shintoism in Meiji.

sen.j: 寺伝では聖武天皇が長弓寺の鎮守として建てさせたものという。
sen.e: According to the temple history, it was constructed as Chokyu-ji's chinju (local Shinto deity) by the order of Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the temple history, it was constructed as Chokyu-ji's chinju (local Shinto deity) by the order of Emperor Shomu.
According to the temple history, it was constructed as Chokyu-ji's chinju (local Shinto deity) by the order of Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 長弓寺の参道入口に鳥居が立つことからもうかがえるように、近世以前は神仏混交の信仰が行われていた。
sen.e: As shown by a torii standing at the entrance of the gateway to Chokyu-ji Temple, syncretization of Shinto with Buddhism was practiced before the modern times.
sen.cmt: 神仏混交は、用語集の神仏習合と同じとします。
sen.e: As shown by a torii standing at the entrance of the gateway to Chokyu-ji Temple, syncretization of Shinto with Buddhism was practiced before the modern times.
As shown by a torii standing at the entrance of the gateway to Chokyu-ji Temple, syncretization of Shinto with Buddhism was practiced before the modern times.

sen.j: 境内奥に国宝の本堂が建つ。
sen.e: The main hall, a national treasure, stands at the end of the precincts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The main hall, a national treasure, stands at the end of the precincts.
The main hall, a national treasure, stands at the end of the precincts.

sen.j: 右側（東）には伊弉諾神社 (生駒市)、薬師院、左側（西）には円生院、法華院、宝光院がある。
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shrine (Ikoma City) and Yakushi-in lie on its right side (east), and Ensho-in, Hokke-in, and Hoko-in on its left side (west).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Izanagi-jinja Shrine (Ikoma City) and Yakushi-in lie on its right side (east), and Ensho-in, Hokke-in, and Hoko-in on its left side (west).
Izanagi-jinja Shrine (Ikoma City) and Yakushi-in lie on its right side (east), and Ensho-in, Hokke-in, and Hoko-in on its left side (west).

sen.j: 長弓寺本寺には住職がなく、4つの塔頭が輪番制で本堂を護持している。
sen.e: As the main temple of Chokyu-ji has no chief priest, the main hall is managed by its four sub-temples by rotation.
As the main temple of Chokyu-ji has no chief priest, the main hall is managed by its four sub-temples by rotation.
As the main temple of Chokyu-ji has no chief priest, the main hall is managed by its four sub-temples by rotation.

sen.j: 塔頭のうち薬師院、円生院、法華院は宿坊を営業し、精進料理を提供している。
sen.e: Yakushi-in, Ensho-in, and Hokke-in among the sub-temples run shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple), offering a vegetarian dish.
Yakushi-in, Ensho-in, and Hokke-in among the sub-temples run shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple), offering a vegetarian dish.
Yakushi-in, Ensho-in, and Hokke-in among the sub-temples run shukubo (visitors' or pilgrims' lodgings in a temple), offering a vegetarian dish.

sen.j: 本堂（国宝）
sen.e: Main Hall (National treasure)
Main Hall (National treasure)
Main Hall (National treasure)

sen.j: 棟木銘から弘安2年（1279年）に建立されたとわかる。
sen.e: The signature on a ridgepole indicates it was constructed in 1279.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The signature on a ridgepole indicates it was constructed in 1279.
The signature on a ridgepole indicates it was constructed in 1279.

sen.j: 入母屋造・檜皮葺の建物である。
sen.e: It is an irimoya-zukuri (hip-and-gable roof construction) building with hiwadabuki (construction with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) roof.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。檜皮葺の建物は、用語集の桧皮葺の用語にroofを付け加えました。
sen.e: It is an irimoya-zukuri (hip-and-gable roof construction) building with a hiwadabuki (construction with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) roof.
It is an irimoya-zukuri (hip-and-gable roof construction) building with a hiwadabuki (construction with the bark of hinoki, Japanese cypress) roof.

sen.j: 和様を基調にしつつ扉（桟唐戸）・頭貫（かしらぬき）の木鼻（用材の端部に装飾彫刻を施す）の意匠などには大仏様を採り入れるなど鎌倉時代の新和様の典型的な建築といえる。
sen.e: It is a typical new Japanese architectural style building in the Kamakura period, adopting Daibutshu-yo (Buddhist architectural style) for the designs, etc. of doors (sangarado, paneled entrance doors introduced from China), kibana (the end of the beam penetrating a pole) of kashira-nuki (head rail), with decorative carving at the end of the materials, while using the Japanese architectural style as its base.

It is a typical new Japanese architectural style building in the Kamakura period, adopting Daibutsu-yo (Buddhist architectural style) for the designs, etc. of doors (sangarado, paneled entrance doors introduced from China) and kibana (the end of the beam penetrating a pole) of kashira-nuki (head rail) with decorative carving at the end of the timber, while using the Japanese architectural style as its base.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記ミスがありました(daibutsu)。and抜けあり、補足しました。「用材＝木」なのでtimberの方が良いと思います。NC check: Please check if this sentence is understandable enough and has no error.
sen.e: It is a typical new Japanese architectural style building in the Kamakura period, adopting Daibutsu-yo (Buddhist architectural style) for the designs, etc. of doors (sangarado, paneled entrance doors introduced from China) and kibana (the end of the beam penetrating a pole) of kashira-nuki (head rail) with decorative carving at the end of the timber, while using the Japanese architectural style as its base.

sen.j: 内部は柱間3間にわたる長大な虹梁（こうりょう）を架け、礼拝空間である外陣（げじん）を広く取っているのが特色である。
sen.e: It is characterized by a long and large koryo (moderately carved beam like a rainbow) fixed over the bay of 3-ken in length and a large gejin (outer place of worship for public people) for the worshipping place.
sen.cmt: 柱間3間は、用語不明。Bay of 3 ken in lengthとしました。
sen.e: It is characterized by a long and large koryo (moderately carved beam like a rainbow) fixed over the bay (space or distance between two pillars) of 3-ken (1 ken is 1.818 m) in length and a large gejin (the outer place of worship for public people).

It is characterized by a long and large koryo (moderately curved beam like a rainbow) fixed over the bay (space or distance between two pillars) of 3-ken (1 ken is 1.818 m) in length and a large gejin (the outer place of worship for public people).

sen.j: 三重塔跡
sen.e: Site of Three-storied Pagoda
Site of Three-storied Pagoda
Site of Three-storied Pagoda

sen.j: 長弓寺にはかつて鎌倉時代建立とされる三重塔があった。
sen.e: Chokyu-ji had a three-storied pagoda that was constructed in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chokyu-ji Temple used to have a three-storied pagoda that was said to have been constructed in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: Chokyu-ji Templeとしました。「とされる」の意を補足しました。
sen.e: Chokyu-ji Temple used to have a three-storied pagoda that was said to have been constructed in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 再度の移転の末、現在は初層部分のみが東京都港区の高輪プリンスホテルに移築されている。
sen.e: After the pagoda was moved two times, presently only the first story portion remains in the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in Minato Ward, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the pagoda was moved two times, presently only the first story portion remains in the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in Minato Ward, Tokyo.
After the pagoda was moved two times, presently only the first story portion remains in the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in Minato Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 1934年の室戸台風で長弓寺は本堂の屋根が大破するなどの大きな被害を受けた。
sen.e: When Chokyu-ji was heavily damaged by the Muroto typhoon in 1934, the roof of its main hall was destroyed.
When Chokyu-ji Temple was heavily damaged by the Muroto typhoon in 1934, the roof of its main hall was destroyed.
When Chokyu-ji Temple was heavily damaged by the Muroto typhoon in 1934, the roof of its main hall was destroyed.

sen.j: 寺では修理費用捻出のため、三重塔を売却することとなった。
sen.e: The temple decided to sell the three-storied pagoda to raise the repair cost.
The temple decided to sell the three-storied pagoda to raise the repair cost.
The temple decided to sell the three-storied pagoda to raise the repair cost.

sen.j: なお、三重塔の二層・三層は早くに失われていた。
sen.e: To be more precise, the second and third stories of the three-storied pagoda had been lost earlier.
To be more precise, the second and third stories of the three-storied pagoda had been lost earlier.
To be more precise, the second and third stories of the three-storied pagoda had been lost earlier.

sen.j: 当時すでに初層のみが残っている状態であったらしい。
sen.e: It is said only the first story remained at that time.
It is said only the first story remained at that time.
It is said only the first story remained at that time.

sen.j: 塔はいったん、ある実業家の所有となって鎌倉市に移築された後、1954年高輪プリンスホテル庭園内に移築され、「観音堂」と称されている。
sen.e: After the tower had been once possessed by a businessman, and moved to Kamakura City, it was moved to the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in 1954, and is now called "Kannon-do Hall."
After the tower was once possessed by a certain businessman and moved to Kamakura City, it was moved to the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in 1954, and is now called "Kannon-do Hall."
After the tower was once possessed by a certain businessman and moved to Kamakura City, it was moved to the garden of Takanawa Prince Hotel in 1954, and is now called "Kannon-do Hall."

sen.j: 同ホテルには他にもと長弓寺にあった門と鐘楼も移築されている。
sen.e: In addition to that, the gate and belfry, which had been in Chokyu-ji, were moved to the hotel.
In addition to that, the gate and belfry, which had been in Chokyu-ji Temple, were moved to the hotel.
In addition to that, the gate and belfry, which had been in Chokyu-ji Temple, were moved to the hotel.

sen.j: 真弓塚
sen.e: Mayumi-zuka (Mayumi Tumulus)
Mayumi-zuka (Mayumi Tumulus)
Mayumi-zuka (Mayumi Tumulus)

sen.j: 寺の東方1kmほどのところにあり、真弓長弓の塚とも、聖武天皇の弓を埋めたところとも伝える（伝承では聖武天皇の弓の一部を使って、本尊十一面観音の頭上の仏面を刻んだとされている）。
sen.e: It is located one kilometer east from the temple, and said to be the tumulus of Mayumi Osayumi, or the place where Emperor Shomu's arrow was buried (A legend says part of Emperor Shomu's arrow was used to carve the head of Buddha on the head of the principal image of eleven-faced Kannon).

It is located one kilometer east from the temple, and said to be the tumulus of Mayumi Takeyumi, or the place where Emperor Shomu's arrow was buried (A legend says part of Emperor Shomu's arrow was used to carve the head of Buddha on the head of the principal image of eleven-faced Kannon).
sen.cmt: 表記ミス(Takeyumi)がありました。
sen.e: It is located one kilometer east from the temple, and said to be the tumulus of Mayumi Takeyumi, or the place where Emperor Shomu's arrow was buried (A legend says part of Emperor Shomu's arrow was used to carve the head of Buddha on the head of the principal image of eleven-faced Kannon).

sen.j: 国宝
sen.e: National Treasure
National Treasure
National Treasure

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Main Hall
Main Hall
Main Hall

sen.j: 重要文化財
sen.e: Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties
Important Cultural Properties

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon
Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon
Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon

sen.j: 本堂の本尊として黒漆厨子に安置されている平安後期の一木造の像である。
sen.e: A statue carved from a single tree trunk in the late Heian period, which is placed in the black lacquered zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of (the) Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) as the principal statue of the main hall.

It is a statue carved from a single tree trunk in the late Heian period, which is placed in the black lacquered zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of [the] Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) as the principal statue of the main hall.
sen.cmt: It isを加え一文としました。
sen.e: It is a statue carved from a single tree trunk in the late Heian period, which is placed in the black lacquered zushi (a cupboard-like case with double doors in which an image of [the] Buddha, a sutra, or some other revered object is kept at a temple) as the principal statue of the main hall.

sen.j: 目のつり上がった個性的な面貌や奥行きのある体躯などに古様が残る。
sen.e: The ancient style is left in its distinctive face with narrow eyes, thick body, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「目のつり上がった」の用語は不明。With narrow eyesとしました。
sen.e: The ancient style is left in its distinctive face with narrow eyes, thick body, and so on.
The ancient style is left in its distinctive face with narrow eyes, thick body, and so on.

sen.j: 黒漆厨子
sen.e: Black lacquered zushi
Black lacquered zushi
Black lacquered zushi

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon
Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon
Wooden standing statue of eleven-faced Kannon

sen.j: 松の一木から彫り出された鎌倉時代の像で、慶派仏師の流れをくむ康俊（こうしゅん）・康成（こうぜい）親子の作と考えられる。
sen.e: Statue carved from a single pine tree trunk in the Kamakura period, which is believed to have been carved by Koshun and his son, Kozei, who were descended from Keiha school sculptors of Buddha.

It is a statue carved from a single pine tree trunk in the Kamakura period, which is believed to have been carved by Koshun and his son, Kozei, who were belonging to the Keiha school of Buddhist sculpture.
sen.cmt: It isを加え一文としました。一部単語を変更しました。
sen.e: It is a statue carved from a single pine tree trunk in the Kamakura period, which is believed to have been carved by Koshun and his son, Kozei, who were belonging to the Keiha school of Buddhist sculpture.

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道白庭台駅より徒歩13分
sen.e: 13-minute walk from Shiraniwadai Station of Kinki Nippon Railway.
13-minute walk from Shiraniwadai Station of Kinki Nippon Railway.
13-minute walk from Shiraniwadai Station of Kinki Nippon Railway.

sen.j: 近鉄富雄駅より奈良交通バス（高山方面行き）「生駒上町」下車、徒歩10分（本数は少ない）
sen.e: Take a Nara Kotsu Bus Line bus (for Takayama) at Tomio Station of Kinki Nippon Railway, get off at "Ikoma Kamimachi", and walk ten minutes (Not so frequent bus services).
Take a Nara Kotsu Bus Line bus (for Takayama) at Tomio Station of Kinki Nippon Railway, get off at "Ikoma Kamimachi", and walk ten minutes (Not so frequent bus services).
Take a Nara Kotsu Bus Line bus (for Takayama) at Tomio Station of Kinki Nippon Railway, get off at "Ikoma Kamimachi", and walk ten minutes (Not so frequent bus services).

sen.j: 近鉄学園前駅 (奈良県)より奈良交通バス（学研北生駒駅行き）「真弓4丁目」下車、徒歩15分
sen.e: Take a Nara Kotsu Bus Line bus (for Gakken Kita-Ikoma Station) at Gakuen-mae Station (Nara Prefecture) of Kinki Nippon Railway, get off at "Mayumi 4-chome," and walk 15 minutes.
Take a Nara Kotsu Bus Line bus (for Gakken Kita-Ikoma Station) at Gakuen-mae Station (Nara Prefecture) of Kinki Nippon Railway, get off at "Mayumi 4-chome," and walk 15 minutes.
